bioghist.p: The American Bible Society was founded in New York City in 1816. Its stated purpose is in "presenting the Bible in compelling ways so that people may experience life in its fullness through faith in Jesus Christ."

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of clippings related to publications of the American Bible Society, 1951-1954, including mastheads, publication notices, address and broadcast notices, and news stories. Articles were taken from the Watchman Examiner, the Philabaptist, the Illinois Baptist, the United Presbyterian, the Christian Advocate, and other papers.
